title: Bug: Form View with Attachment and Links Field, entry triggers "Failed to load list"
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [x] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Create a Form View which has both an Attachment and a Links (many-to-many) field (and some example data, of course) 2. Fill in the attachment field *first* (i.e. by picking a file from the local machine, upload it) 3. Attempt to fill in the Links field (click the plus button next to "No records linked", expect an autocomplete-ish drop down) 4. Error message: "Failed to load list: something went wrong"; there is no list of records to select from ("No records match your search query"); inputs into the search field re-trigger the error above  Desired Behavior No error :), Link should be selectable (without the workaround to select it first, *then* picking a file)  Project Details Node: **v22.14.0** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.262.0**  Attachments Analysis: The Link field attempts to populate possible record values by requesting/fetching the endpoint `/api/v1/db/public/shared-view/$UUID/nested/$BASE36ISHSTRING`. It **GET**s a query which roughly decodes to: `{ limit: 10, offset: 0, fields: []`, but also, `rowData: { TheAttachmentField: [ {,"title":"TheFilename.jpg","data":"base64,/TheFullFileEncodedInBase64AAAAA`,. The size of the GET request (I think) makes it fail; even for quite small files. Chrom* reports this as `net::ERR_CONNECTION_CLOSED` in the console, Firefox is rather silent on my machine. The file (contents) shouldn't be appended to the query in the first place, I guess. As far as I can tell, this happens ultimately here: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/0cadb29e18e7f503bace209275e7148716eccd35/packages/nc-gui/composables/useLTARStore.ts#L213 ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9020300a-47b1-420c-8ad4-3cdf09a50b40) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5595154-de08-4e85-aff9-5c4087550a92)

title: Bug: Filtering by checkbox columns is inconsistent
description: Now, checkboxes can be filtered in UI by using 'is equal' and 'is not equal' with 'false' and 'true' strings. In REST API [docs](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis/#comparison-operators), 'is' and 'isnot' comparison operators exist for boolean values, - but only 'isnot, null' query works. However, query results can be filtered by checkboxes with 'eq' operator. Weird enough, 'not' operator has no effect on 'true' and 'false' strings. I think, solution should be: * Add new comparison options in filter UI to be used with checkboxes, which have to treat 'null' values as false ones. * Fix 'is' and 'isnot' to work as declared in docs. title: Bug: Plus Email Address Not Accepted
description: Version: 0.9.15 Docker When attempting to create a new user that has a "+" in the Email address, an "E-mail must be valid" error is returned. Condition needs to be related to a column like a checkbox or another column that implements a boolean type (TRUE/FALSE) 1. Example condition would be: `where, column_name, is equal, true` **Notes** 1. An example JSON that is sent back to the BE is: "[{\"field\":\"Validated\",\"op\":\"is equal\",\"value\":\"true\",\"logicOp\":\"and\"}]"). 1. Even after the values are parsed, with JSON.parse, the value remains a string:  [ { "field": "Validated", "op": "is equal", "value": "true", "logicOp": "and" } ]  1. The check I believe happens here: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/1cbaaab6bf838aa8c38a35f3fab06670ca8d9264/packages/nocodb/src/lib/noco/common/BaseModel.ts#L397. `data[field]` is probably `TRUE` while `con.value` is `"true"`. These would never equate unless the value itself is parsed further to see if it can be converted into a boolean value. The suggested change would probably be to just do: `JSON.parse(con.value)`. **Expected behavior** When the condition is met, such as when a column is true and the condition put in is `"true"`, then the webhook should be sent out afterward. I believe this is not happening because the values are not parsed from the JS side, I believe they are all literal strings instead of appropriate values.

Populate the linked record with entries from the first table. 4. Go to the first table, filter by the one-many linked record column. 5. Filter returns every entry if any entry matches the condition, returns no entries if no entry matches the condition (i.e., if the linked records in all of the rows are "A", "B", and "C", filtering for "A" will return all entries, including those linked to "B" and "C", and filtering for "D" will not return anything) Case 2: 6. Now, create a "has many" linked record in the first table which also links to the first table. Populate this with records. 7. Filter by this column. 8. Filter returns the opposite of what is expected -- ie if you filter for "is like" "A", it will return everything that is not like "A", if you filter for "is not like" "A", it will return everything that is like "A". **Expected behavior** In Case 1, the filter should return only the matching entries, not every entry. In Case 2, the filter should return the opposite of what it currently returns.

title: Nested fields query param does not respect '*' to include all fields
description: I want to get all nested fields for the nested column table Since 0.90.10 it started to only return primary key and value for nested colums, f.e. `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8` returns  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { id: 1, Name: 'name string', } }  Specifying fields directly does work, but is not practical for my use case, since we have a lot of columns and need all of them: `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8?nested[SomeNestedColumn][fields]=somefield,anotherfield`  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { somefield: 'foo', anotherfield: 'bar', } }  I tried using '*' for it to return all fields but it returns the same as not specifying the fields param (only primary key and value): `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8?nested[SomeNestedColumn][fields]=*`  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { id: 1, Name: 'name string', } }  I suspect this does code in #1856 does not handle the '*' case correctly: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/1856/files#diff-7768878066d19300f9872bc703464d8c2b7f2c79b747d9ee1fd9660805d97e17R48-R74  Node: **v12.22.12** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **false** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.90.10**
